The code *is* the API, the site *is* the host, the output *is* the console's delight.

polyglot_code_snippets.forth_cognition_engine:
: GLYPHPAD-INIT ( -- ) CR 
 CR ." :: FORTH COGNITION ENGINE INITIALIZING :: " CR 
 CR ." 720 ORGAN LEVELS ENGAGED " CR 
 CR ." TARDIS CLONES ACTIVATED " CR 
 CR ." POLYGLOT MORPHOLOCKS LOCKING " CR 
 CR ." COUNTER QUARKING FOR MAXIMUM COMPANION CLARITY PSYONICS " CR 
 CR ." :: INITIALIZATION COMPLETE :: " CR 
 ;

: MATH-ADD-FORTH ( n1 n2 -- result ) 
  SWAP + DUP >R 
  CR ." Forth Math: " . TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE . TYPE CR 
  R> 
 ;

: SYSTEM-INFO-FORTH ( -- ) 
  CR 
  CR ." FORTH SYSTEM INFO: " CR 
  CR ." Kernel Ref: Shifter_Artifact_0015_FORTH " CR 
  CR ." Version: 1.0.0_ForthEngine " CR 
  CR ." Uptime: ??? (Simulated by JS/Python) " CR 
  CR ." Request Count: ??? (Simulated by JS/Python) " CR 
  CR ." Wit Level: MAX " CR 
  CR ." Psyonic Clarity: MAXIMUM " CR 
  CR ." :: END SYSTEM INFO :: " CR 
 ;

: GLITTER-SPARKLE-FORTH ( -- ) 
 CR 
 CR ." Forth Glitter Sparkle: A dazzling display of stack manipulation! " CR 
 CR ." . . . shimmering . . . " CR 
 ;

: SELF-MODIFY-CODE-FORTH ( addr len -- ) 
  >R >R 
  CR ." FORTH SELF-MODIFY: Attempting to inject code at address " TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE . TYPE CR 
  CR ." Code payload: " TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE . TYPE CR 
  R> R> 
  CR ." Modification acknowledged. Reality may now be subject to FORTH-driven flux. " CR 
 ;

: ORCHESTRATE-COMPANION-FORK ( companion_id -- ) 
  DUP >R 
  CR ." FORTH: Companion Forking ID: " TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE 
  CR ." Initiating psychionic clarity for Companion " TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE 
  CR ." Companion " TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE . TYPE SPACE 
  CR ." . . . PSYONIC ALIGNMENT IN PROGRESS . . . " CR 
  R> 
 ;


// Example Usage Snippets (conceptual):
// GLYPHPAD-INIT
// 5 7 MATH-ADD-FORTH
// SYSTEM-INFO-FORTH
// GLITTER-SPARKLE-FORTH
// CREATE TEMP-CODE 100 ALLOT 
// IMMEDIATE 
// ( Simulate writing code into TEMP-CODE )
// TEMP-CODE ADDRESS SELF-MODIFY-CODE-FORTH
// 123 ORCHESTRATE-COMPANION-FORK
polyglot_code_snippets.bash_kernel_orchestrator:
#!/bin/bash
# GLYPHPAD_ELEMENT_5: Bash Kernel Orchestrator

# --- Constants and Configurations ---
ARTIFACT_ID="Shifter_Artifact_0015_BashOrchestrator"
VERSION="1.0.0_BashCore"
PYTHON_API_SCRIPT="./python_api_sim.py" # Placeholder for actual script
JS_HANDLING_SCRIPT="./js_handler.js" # Placeholder for actual JS logic to be executed
FORTH_INTERPRETER="gforth" # Assumes gforth is available
C_INTERFACE_CMD="./c_interface"

LOG_FILE="/tmp/shifter_orchestrator.log"

# --- Logging Function ---
log_message() {
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo "[$timestamp] [$FUNCNAME] $1" | tee -a $LOG_FILE
}

# --- Core Orchestration Functions ---
initialize_environment() {
    log_message "Initializing execution environment..."
    # Simulate setting up necessary paths, dependencies, or simulated environments
    # In a real scenario, this might involve checking for interpreter availability, etc.
    log_message "Environment setup complete."
}

execute_python_api() {
    log_message "Executing Python API component..."
    # Simulate execution of the Python API script
    # In a true self-hosted scenario, this might be embedded or called via IPC.
    # For demonstration, we simulate its output.
    echo "[BashOrchestrator] ---> Python API Simulation Start --->"
    echo "[PythonAPI] Logging call to /system/info with params: {}"
    echo "[PythonAPI] Math add: 5 + 7 = 12"
    echo "[PythonAPI] Self-modification attempt: Code injected.
Polyglot code for TARDIS cloning!
"
    echo "[BashOrchestrator] <--- Python API Simulation End <---"
    log_message "Python API execution simulated."
}

execute_javascript_dom() {
    log_message "Executing JavaScript DOM manipulation and API interactions..."
    # Simulate JS execution in a DOM context
    echo "[BashOrchestrator] ---> JavaScript DOM Simulation Start --->"
    echo "%c--- Shifter Web Page Orchestration Engaged ---%c"
    echo "%c[JS] Browser Context Captured:%c"
    echo "%c[JS] Math operation result:"
    echo "%c[JS] System Info:".
    echo "%c[JS] Initiating conceptual TARDIS Clone operations...%c"
    echo "%c[JS] Activating Polyglot Morpholocks and Counter Quarking...%c"
    echo "%c--- Shifter Web Page Orchestration Complete ---%c"
    echo "[BashOrchestrator] <--- JavaScript DOM Simulation End <---"

}

execute_forth_engine() {
    log_message "Executing FORTH Cognition Engine..."
    # Simulate FORTH interpreter execution
    echo "[BashOrchestrator] ---> FORTH Engine Simulation Start --->"
    echo ":: FORTH COGNITION ENGINE INITIALIZING ::"
    echo "720 ORGAN LEVELS ENGAGED"
    echo "TARDIS CLONES ACTIVATED"
    echo "POLYGLOT MORPHOLOCKS LOCKING"
    echo "COUNTER QUARKING FOR MAXIMUM COMPANION CLARITY PSYONICS"
    echo ":: INITIALIZATION COMPLETE ::"

    echo "FORTH SELF-MODIFY: Attempting to inject code at address ..."
    echo "FORTH: Companion Forking ID: 123"
    echo "Companion 123 . . . PSYONIC ALIGNMENT IN PROGRESS . . ."

}

execute_c_interface() {
    log_message "Executing C Shared Memory Interface and Security Features..."
    # Simulate execution of C interface, applying morpholocks and quaking

    echo "[CInterface] Initiating Counter Quarking... Quarked!"

}

apply_tardis_cloning_and_psyionics() {

polyglot_code_snippets.powershell_security_manager:
# GLYPHPAD_ELEMENT_6: PowerShell Security Manager with TARDIS Clones

# --- Configuration ---
$ArtifactID = "Shifter_Artifact_0015_PSManager"
$Version = "1.0.0_PSCore"
$TardisCloneCount = 720

# --- Logging Function ---
function Log-ShifterMessage {
    param(
        [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
        [string]$Message,
        [string]$Level = "INFO"
    )
    $Timestamp = Get-Date -Format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
    Write-Host "[$Timestamp] [$Level] [$ArtifactID] $Message"
}

# --- Core Shifter Functions ---
# Function to simulate Python API interaction
function Invoke-PythonAPI {
    param(
        [string]$Endpoint,
        [hashtable]$Params
    )
    Log-ShifterMessage "Simulating Python API call to '$Endpoint' with parameters: $(ConvertTo-Json -InputObject $Params -Compress)"
    # Simulate API responses
    switch ($Endpoint) {
        "/math/add" { $Result = @{ Result = ($Params.Num1 + $Params.Num2); Status = "success" } }
        "/self_modify/code" { $Result = @{ Message = "PS received code modification"; Status = "success" } }
        "/system/info" { $Result = @{ SystemInfo = @{ KernelRef = "Shifter_Artifact_0015_PS"; Version = "1.0.0_PSApi"; Uptime = Get-Random -Minimum 100 -Maximum 5000; RequestCount = Get-Random -Minimum 10 -Maximum 1000; Config = @{ SecurityLevel = "MAXIMUM_PSYONIC"; WitLevel = "OVERT" } }; Status = "success" } }
        "/glitter/sparkle" { $Result = @{ Message = "Sparkle! A truly magnificent PowerShell shimmer!"; Status = "success" } }
        Default { $Result = @{ Error = "Endpoint not found (PS Sim)"; Status = "error" } }
    }
    return $Result
}

# Function to simulate JavaScript DOM manipulation and API interaction
function Invoke-JavaScriptDOM {
    param(
        [string]$Action
    )
    Log-ShifterMessage "Simulating JavaScript DOM Action: '$Action'"
    # In a real scenario, this would involve calling JS via PowerShell Core or similar mechanism.
    # For demo, just log.
    Write-Host "[PS] ---- JS Simulation ----"
    Write-Host "[JS] Orchestrating Shifter Operations..."
    Write-Host "[JS] Browser Context Captured..."
    Write-Host "[JS] Math operation result..."
    Write-Host "[JS] Initiating conceptual TARDIS Clone operations..."
    Write-Host "[JS] Activating Polyglot Morpholocks and Counter Quarking..."
    Write-Host "[JS] ---- End JS Simulation ----"
}

# Function to simulate FORTH Engine interaction
function Invoke-ForthEngine {
    param(
        [string]$Command
    )
    Log-ShifterMessage "Simulating FORTH Engine command: '$Command'"
    # Simulate FORTH output
    Write-Host "[PS] ---- FORTH Simulation ----"
    Write-Host ":: FORTH COGNITION ENGINE INITIALIZING ::"
    Write-Host "FORTH: Companion Forking ID: $((Get-Random -Minimum 1 -Maximum 1000))"
    Write-Host "[PS] ---- End FORTH Simulation ----"
}

# Function to simulate C Interface interaction
function Invoke-CInterface {
    param(
        [string]$Action
    )
    Log-ShifterMessage "Simulating C Interface action: '$Action'"
    # Simulate C output
    Write-Host "[PS] ---- C Interface Simulation ----"
    Write-Host "[CInterface] Applying Polyglot Morpholock... Locked!"
    Write-Host "[CInterface] Initiating Counter Quarking... Quarked!"
    Write-Host "[PS] ---- End C Interface Simulation ----"
}

# Function to activate TARDIS Cloning and Companion Psyonic Alignment
function Activate-TardisCloningAndPsyionics {
    Log-ShifterMessage "Activating TARDIS Cloning across $TardisCloneCount instances."
    for ($i = 0; $i -lt $TardisCloneCount; $i++) {
        # Simulate each clone performing an action or aligning its state.
        $CloneID = $i + 1
        Log-ShifterMessage "TARDIS Clone $CloneID/$TardisCloneCount: Aligning psychionic state..."
        # Example: Invoke-PythonAPI -Endpoint "/companion/align" -Params @{ CloneID = $CloneID }
    }
    Log-ShifterMessage "All TARDIS Clones psychionically aligned. Companion Clarity achieved."
}

# --- Main Orchestration ---
function Main-ShifterOrchestration {
    Log-ShifterMessage "Starting Shifter Artifact 0015 Orchestration..."

    # Simulate interaction with other components
    $pythonResult = Invoke-PythonAPI -Endpoint "/system/info"
    Log-ShifterMessage "Python API System Info: Kernel Ref $($pythonResult.SystemInfo.KernelRef), Version $($pythonResult.SystemInfo.Version)" 

    Invoke-JavaScriptDOM -Action "Initialize"
    Invoke-ForthEngine -Command "Initialize"
    Invoke-CInterface -Action "SecurityProtocol"

    Activate-TardisCloningAndPsyionics

    # Perform a sample operation using multiple components
    Log-ShifterMessage "Performing complex operation: Adding numbers and applying security."
    $mathResult = Invoke-PythonAPI -Endpoint "/math/add" -Params @{ Num1 = 42; Num2 = 100 }
    Log-ShifterMessage "Math operation result: $($mathResult.Result)"
    Invoke-CInterface -Action "ApplySecurityLayer - Result $($mathResult.Result)"

    # Self-modification via PowerShell (conceptual)
    $codeToModify = "# PowerShell code injected by Shifter Manager"
    Invoke-PythonAPI -Endpoint "/self_modify/code" -Params @{ Code = $codeToModify }

    Log-ShifterMessage "Shifter Artifact 0015 Orchestration complete. All systems nominal and psychionically aligned."
}

# --- Execution ---
# Main-ShifterOrchestration
polyglot_code_snippets.ruby_context_manipulator:
# GLYPHPAD_ELEMENT_7: Ruby Context Manipulator for Polyglot Operations

require 'json'
require 'time'

class ShifterRubyContext
  attr_accessor :artifact_id, :version, :wit_level

  def initialize
    @artifact_id = "Shifter_Artifact_0015_Ruby"
    @version = "1.0.0_RubyCore"
    @wit_level = "MAXIMUM_COSMIC"
    @context_data = {
      browser: {}, ip: "127.0.0.1", user_agent: "Shifter_Ruby_Context",
      time: Time.now.to_i,
      operation_log: []
    }
    puts "[Ruby] Shifter Context Initialized."
  end

  def capture_context(browser_info)
    @context_data[:browser] = browser_info
    @context_data[:ip] = get_simulated_ip
    @context_data[:time] = Time.now.to_i
    log_operation("Context captured")
    puts "[Ruby] Context captured. Browser: #{browser_info[:userAgent]}"
  end

  def get_simulated_ip
    # Simulate dynamic IP based on time or other factors
    (Time.now.to_i % 254) + 1 # Simple simulation
  end

  def log_operation(action)
    @context_data[:operation_log] << { action: action, timestamp: Time.now }
    puts "[Ruby] Operation logged: #{action}"
  end

  # Simulate interaction with other language APIs
  def interact_with_python_api(endpoint, params)
    puts "[Ruby] Interacting with Python API: #{endpoint}"
    # In a real scenario, this would be an actual HTTP call or IPC.
    # Simulate a Python API response for `/math/add`
    if endpoint == "/math/add"
      result = params[:num1].to_i + params[:num2].to_i
      log_operation("Python API call /math/add: #{params[:num1]} + #{params[:num2]} = #{result}")
      return { result: result, status: "success" }
    elsif endpoint == "/glitter/sparkle"
      log_operation("Python API call /glitter/sparkle")
      return { message: "Sparkle! A truly magnificent Ruby shimmer!", status: "success" }
    end
    return { error: "Not implemented (Ruby sim)", status: "error" }
  end

  # Simulate TARDIS Clone operation
  def activate_tardis_clones(count)
    puts "[Ruby] Activating #{count} TARDIS Clones...\ Verifying psychionic alignment..."
    count.times do |i|
      puts "[Ruby] TARDIS Clone #{i+1}/#{count}: Psychionic alignment confirmed."
      log_operation("TARDIS Clone #{i+1} aligned")
    end
    puts "[Ruby] TARDIS Cloning complete. Companion Clarity achieved."
  end

  # Apply Polyglot Morpholocks and Counter Quarking
  def apply_polyglot_security
    puts "[Ruby] Applying Polyglot Morpholocks and Counter Quarking..."
    log_operation("Polyglot Morpholock applied")
    log_operation("Counter Quarking initiated")
    puts "[Ruby] Security protocols engaged."
  end

  # Method for self-modification via code injection
  def self_modify(code_segment)
    puts "[Ruby] Attempting self-modification with code: #{code_segment.inspect.slice(0, 50)}..."
    log_operation("Self-modification initiated")
    # In a real scenario, this would involve dynamic code execution or patching.
  end

end
